title: General Nouns Related to Health and Sickness
originalTitle: General Nouns Related to Health and Sickness

examples: Regular exercise and healthy eating habits can prevent many illnesses as prevention is better than cure.
We never spoke about her illness.
You may find your illness hard to accept.
Emily had just recovered from her illness and was now in the pink of health.
The doctor examined her body to check for any signs of illness or injury.
words.defineEn: the state of being physically or mentally ill; a period of sickness or disease
words.defineVi: tình trạng bị bệnh về thể chất hoặc tinh thần; một thời kỳ ốm đau hoặc bệnh tật

examples: The disease wiped out 40 million rabbits at a stroke.
Newer treatments for the disease are in the pipeline.
As with all diseases, certain groups will be more at risk than others.
Efforts were made to check the disease.
Efforts to stop the spread of the disease.
words.defineEn: an illness in a human, animal, or plant that affects health
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh ở người, động vật hoặc thực vật ảnh hưởng đến sức khỏe

examples: The feeling of sickness soon passed.
Mark's excessive motion sickness during the roller coaster ride forced him to take a break and drive the porcelain bus in the nearby restroom.

I didn't appreciate the little things my body could do, like running and jumping, until I was injured and couldn't do them anymore - health is not valued till sickness comes, and I miss my old abilities.
After an hour of exposure at these levels, radiation sickness sets in.
Maybe you had horrible morning sickness.
words.defineEn: the state of being unwell
words.defineVi: tình trạng không khỏe

examples: Once one child in the school has the infection, it spreads like wildfire.
The pandemic has run its course in some countries, but others are still struggling with high infection rates.
Infections here are rising.
Long ago, people did not understand infection.
COVID-19 infections set more records today.
words.defineEn: the process or the act of catching or causing a disease resulting from a bacterial or viral infestation
words.defineVi: quá trình hoặc hành động bắt hoặc gây bệnh do nhiễm vi khuẩn hoặc vi rút

examples: Their advice is not meant to send you down a rabbit hole, and involve you in chaos and disorder.
Jake's disordered eating habits have caused him to appear as skinny as a rail.
So conduct disorder.
And up to 18% develop postpartum anxiety disorders.
The biggest problem is diagnosing the disorder in the first place.
words.defineEn: a disease or a medical condition that prevents a part of the body or mind from functioning normally
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh hoặc tình trạng y tế ngăn cản một phần cơ thể hoặc tâm trí hoạt động bình thường

examples: His complaints have a familiar ring.
Complaints must go through the proper channels.
Make a complaint if you are not satisfied with the service.
He made a complaint about the room and the hotel changed his booking.
We keep a record of all complaints that we receive.
words.defineEn: a symptom or a bodily disorder that causes discontent, about which the patient seeks medical assistance
words.defineVi: một triệu chứng hoặc rối loạn cơ thể gây ra sự bất mãn mà bệnh nhân tìm kiếm sự trợ giúp y tế

examples: Her condition is very serious.
All clothes are in mint condition and less than two years old.
The orchard's yield of apples was lower this year due to unfavorable weather conditions.
In addition, road conditions were very poor, which led to greater wear and tear.
Long hours and tough working conditions are often par for the course in catering.
words.defineEn: a medical problem, such as a disorder, illness, etc.
words.defineVi: một vấn đề y tế, chẳng hạn như rối loạn, bệnh tật, vv

examples: Adults were also at risk from epidemics.
Epidemics are also really bad.
Epidemics you contain.
The epidemic went on until approximately the 1350s.
Epidemics and pandemics come in many shapes and forms.
words.defineEn: an occurrence of a disease that spreads and involves a large number of people at the same time in a particular area
words.defineVi: sự xuất hiện của một căn bệnh lây lan và liên quan đến một số lượng lớn người cùng một lúc trong một khu vực cụ thể

examples: Even memories can be spread by contagion.
It's just spread like a contagion from one country to another.
Behavioral contagion is the tendency to repeat a behavior after seeing others perform it.
Because of the coronavirus and the risk of contagion, family members aren’t being allowed in the intensive care unit.
And sadly, the spread of terrible behaviors by contagion is also well-documented, including violence to others and self-harm.
words.defineEn: any disease or virus that can be easily passed from one person to another
words.defineVi: bất kỳ bệnh hoặc vi-rút nào có thể dễ dàng truyền từ người này sang người khác

examples: In ancient Greece, headaches were considered powerful afflictions.
Well, I think Mr. Putin has an affliction like, unfortunately, many world leaders have, which is an innate sense of insecurity as well as paranoia.
Sticking together, giving each other strength and moral support and overcoming the worst, the worst of afflictions and persecutions.

His skin was covered in painful scabs, and he wondered why he alone had been marked with this affliction.
words.defineEn: a state of pain, suffering, or discomfort
words.defineVi: một trạng thái đau đớn, đau khổ, hoặc khó chịu

examples: I've really got the bug for it!
I put a bug in his ear about giving Helen a call.
Yes, I'm as snug as a bug in a rug.
My daughters are all snug as a bug in a rug watching a movie together.
Emily had a terrible stomach bug and spent the entire night puking her guts out.
words.defineEn: a fairly mild yet infectious illness that is caused by a virus or bacteria
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh khá nhẹ nhưng truyền nhiễm gây ra bởi virus hoặc vi khuẩn

examples: The athlete knew that overtraining could lead to burnout and injury, so she balanced intense workouts with rest and recovery, as she believed that honey in excess is no longer sweet.
My grandfather always said early ripe, early rotten when talking about child prodigies, believing that their early success often led to burnout or disappointment later in life.

The coach knew that pushing his players too hard could lead to injury and burnout, so he took care to balance training with rest and recovery, believing that it is part of a good shepherd to shear his flock not skin it.
When it comes to exercise, it's better to start with small and achievable goals rather than trying to do too much too soon and risking injury or burnout.
The athlete wanted to practice for hours on end, but recognized that the spirit is willing, but the flesh is weak, and that taking breaks and pacing oneself was important to avoid burnout and injury.
words.defineEn: ‌the state of being physically tired after working too hard or mentally exhausted after a prolonged period of stress
words.defineVi: ‌tình trạng mệt mỏi về thể chất sau khi làm việc quá sức hoặc kiệt quệ về tinh thần sau một thời gian căng thẳng kéo dài

words.defineEn: a slight illness
words.defineVi: bệnh nhẹ

words.defineEn: the state of being weak and unhealthy, especially due to old age or sickness
words.defineVi: tình trạng yếu ớt và không khỏe mạnh, đặc biệt là do tuổi già hoặc bệnh tật

examples: Early researchers called this circular insanity.
This is insanity.
DONALD TRUMP, Former President of the United States: We should eliminate the insanity of the mass and very corrupt mail-in voting.

That road leads to death, institutions or insanity.
words.defineEn: relatively permanent disorder of the mind
words.defineVi: rối loạn tương đối vĩnh viễn của tâm trí

words.defineEn: (pathology) inability of a bodily part or organ to function normally
words.defineVi: (bệnh lý) một bộ phận hoặc cơ quan trong cơ thể không thể hoạt động bình thường

examples: There's a connection between those two things, where people blame ethnic groups and racial groups for the economic malaise.

We're going to see people in increasing numbers sort of dropping out of our mainstream climb to economic success and so we've got this economic malaise.
words.defineEn: a feeling of being physically ill and irritated without knowing the reason
words.defineVi: một cảm giác bị bệnh về thể chất và bị kích thích mà không biết lý do

examples: This video is going to be part of a project called Mental Illness and Me.

examples: The pandemic has run its course in some countries, but others are still struggling with high infection rates.
When the pandemic hit, many people went to ground and isolated themselves at home to avoid getting sick.

The small business faced financial struggles during the dog days of the pandemic, with reduced customer traffic and revenue.
words.defineEn: a disease that spreads across a large region or even across the world
words.defineVi: một căn bệnh lây lan trên một khu vực rộng lớn hoặc thậm chí trên toàn thế giới

examples: Those interactions could cause serotonin syndrome.

words.defineEn: a set of characteristics, behaviors, or qualities considered as normal for a particular type of person

examples: Memories of that day still bring a lump to his throat.

words.defineEn: a swollen area under the skin, usually caused by a sickness or injury
words.defineVi: một vùng sưng dưới da, thường là do bệnh tật hoặc chấn thương

words.defineVi: một tình trạng hoặc bệnh làm cho một ho thường xuyên

However, this simple sneeze also brings the virus in contact with pets, plants, or even your lunch.
words.defineEn: the act of air blowing out of our nose and mouth in a way that we cannot control
words.defineVi: hành động thổi không khí ra khỏi mũi và miệng theo cách mà chúng ta không thể kiểm soát

examples: Cysts in muscle tissue may cause no symptoms, or just a slightly sore lump.
It's s cyst.
But that is a cyst.
It's an epidermoid cyst.
No one knows the largest recorded cyst in the world.
words.defineEn: a growth with abnormal features that appears in the body and contains fluid
words.defineVi: một sự tăng trưởng với các đặc điểm bất thường xuất hiện trong cơ thể và chứa chất lỏng

words.defineEn: physical weakness or infirmity that is caused by a disease, illness, or aging
words.defineVi: suy nhược cơ thể hoặc ốm yếu do bệnh tật, bệnh tật hoặc lão hóa

words.defineEn: a doctor's report stating that the patient is in good physical or mental health
words.defineVi: báo cáo của bác sĩ nói rằng bệnh nhân có sức khỏe thể chất hoặc tinh thần tốt
